body:
It appears to be broken in master (I see localScalar is used in `is_nonzero`):

```
>>> import torch
>>> i = torch.LongTensor([[0, 2], [1, 0], [1, 2]])
>>> v = torch.FloatTensor([3,      4,      5    ])
>>> y = torch.sparse.FloatTensor(i.t(), v)
>>> y.is_nonzero()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: numel is not implemented for type torch.sparse.FloatTensor
```

but seems reasonable enough to fix.
